data.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound synthesized?
At what temperature was the crystallographic data for the compound collected?
data.answer: Data were collected at both 250 K and 100 K.

data.question: Is the crystal system of the synthesized compound monoclinic?
What method was used for magnetic measurements of the synthesized compound?
What is the relaxation barrier (Δτ) of the synthesized compound?
Does the synthesized compound exhibit valence tautomerism?
What is the role of Cl− ions in the electronic configuration of the synthesized compound?
data.answer: Cl− ions serve to cathodically shift the FeII/FeIII redox couple.

data.question: Is the synthesized compound a single-chain magnet?
What is the coupling constant (J) of the synthesized compound?
What phenomenon is observed in the synthesized compound upon cooling?
What is the highest reported blocking temperature for single-chain magnets before this study?
Does the synthesized compound exhibit magnetic hysteresis?
What is the coercive field (Hci) observed for the synthesized compound at 1.8 K?
Is the synthesized compound electrically conductive?
What is the conductivity (σ) of the synthesized compound at ambient temperature?
What is the correlation energy (Δξ) of the synthesized compound?
Does the synthesized compound feature strong metal–radical magnetic coupling?
What is the transition temperature (T1/2) observed for the synthesized compound?
What is the role of temperature in the electronic configuration of the synthesized compound?
data.answer: Temperature changes lead to a transition from (L2–)­FeII to (L3–•)­FeIII.

data.question: Is the synthesized compound the first example of a semiquinoid-bridged single-chain magnet?
